question: David wants to make different sized ice cubes with 104 poundss of water. He can make giant cubes that use 6 poundss per cube, medium cubes that use 2 poundss, and small cubes that use 1/12 pounds. If he makes 7 giant cubes, 10 medium cubes, and 24 small cubes, how many poundss of water does he have left?
answer:
The giant cubes used up 42 poundss of water because 7 times 6 equals <<7*6=42>>42.
The medium cubes used up 20 poundss of water because 10 times 2 equals <<10*2=20>>20.
The small cubes used up 2 poundss of water because 24 times 1/12 equals 2.
This means that David has used up 64 poundss of water because 42 plus 20 plus 2 equals 64.
David has 40 poundss of water left because 104 minus 64 equals <<104-64=40>>40.
#### 40
